Science Fairs

Posted by on April 02, 2019 · 3 mins read

I have been participating in science fairs for many years now. Science fairs are all about asking questions and seeking answers. Participating in science fairs fit right in with my interests in robotics.

Why Science Fairs?

Having experienced the FIRST LEGO League research project, I found it to be very similar - come up with a question. Develop a way to test a solution and share your results.

My very first year in Science Fair, I got a third place award at PRSEF (Pittsburgh Regional Science and Engineering Fair). This is the premier science fair and only qualifying fair for national and international events. However, I did not know any of this at the time. I was content with my third place first performance. Then, at the start of my Freshman year, I received notification that I had qualified as a Broadcom MASTERS finalist (Top 30). This won me an all-expenses paid week in Washington D.C. to compete at the national level. I received $500, $1000 for my school and even had a minor planet named for me.

This was just the start. I have competed in science fairs ever since.

I would strongly encourage others to participate as well. You learn not just how to be a scientist, but you also learn how to communicate better.

Working on my project

Science Fair Awards

National/International

2019
Intel International Science and Engineering Fair (ISEF) Finalist
2017
Broadcom MASTERS National Finalist (top 30) science fair project award

State/Regional PJAS

2019
First Place Engineering Region 7, Carnegie Mellon University Civil and Engineering Department Chi Epsilon award
2018
First Place Engineering PA States, Perfect Award, Director’s Engineering Award
2018
First Place Engineering Region 7, Innovation Works Award, an American Vacuum Society–Western PA Chapter Award, and an American Society of Civil Engineers–Pittsburgh Section Award

State/Regional PRSEF

2019
Intel ISEF Finalist Award, FedEx Ground Award, Third Place Senior Division Robotics/Engineering
2018
Second Place Senior Division Robotics/Engineering, FedEx Ground Award, Harrisburg University of Science & Technology Award, Innovation Works Award
2017
Third Place Earth, Space and Environment, Allegheny County Health Department Award, Arconic Foundation Award, Broadcom MASTERS nomination

Other 2017 First Place, Energy Path Science Fair
